titlestmt.titleproper: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration drawings

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 16:53:14 -0400.

did.unittitle: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration drawings

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drawings, ca. 1820-1943, by 225 American artists from the drawing collection in the Cooper Union Museum. A description is included for each drawing.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels NCUD1-NCUD22 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to Cooper Union Museum after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Art museum, N.Y., N.Y. Founded 1897. Name changed to Cooper-Hewitt Museum. Housed in the Carnegie Mansion, home of Andrew Carnegie.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Lent for microfilming 1963-1964 by Cooper Union Museum.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A microfilm inventory available at all Archives of American Art offices.
